Functional Title / Description: Allow users to upload their resume and receive a comprehensive quality analysis, including scores, recommendations, and a structured job history they can use for future applications.
Allow users to upload their resume in commonly used file formats.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** upload my resume as a PDF file, **so that** the system can analyze its content.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: PDF Document Ingestion

Acceptance Criteria: When I upload a PDF file, the system accepts it without error.
When I upload a file that is not a PDF, the system displays an appropriate error message.
The system extracts readable text from the PDF for analysis.

Business Rule: PDF files must be 10MB or less in size.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** upload my resume as a Microsoft Word document (DOCX), **so that** the system can analyze its content.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Word Document Ingestion

Acceptance Criteria: When I upload a DOCX file, the system accepts it without error.
When I upload a file that is not a DOCX, the system displays an appropriate error message.
The system extracts readable text from the document for analysis.

Business Rule: DOCX files must be 10MB or less in size.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** upload my resume as a plain text file (TXT), **so that** the system can analyze its content.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Plain Text Ingestion

Acceptance Criteria: When I upload a TXT file, the system accepts it without error.
The system uses the text content directly for analysis.

Business Rule: TXT files must be 5MB or less in size.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** upload my resume as a Rich Text Format file (RTF), **so that** the system can analyze its content.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Rich Text Ingestion

Acceptance Criteria: When I upload an RTF file, the system accepts it without error.
The system extracts readable text from the RTF for analysis.

Business Rule: RTF files must be 10MB or less in size.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** upload my resume as a Markdown file (MD), **so that** the system can analyze its content.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Markdown Ingestion

Acceptance Criteria: When I upload an MD file, the system accepts it without error.
The system processes Markdown formatting to extract readable text.

Business Rule: MD files must be 5MB or less in size.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** paste my resume text directly into the system, **so that** I can use the system without having a file saved on my computer.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Direct Text Input

Acceptance Criteria: The system provides a text input area where I can paste content.
When I paste text and submit, the system accepts it for analysis.
The system handles special characters and formatting gracefully.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want** the system to automatically detect whether I uploaded a resume or a job description, **so that** it can route me to the correct workflow.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Automated Content Categorization

Acceptance Criteria: When I upload a resume, the system identifies it as a resume.
When I upload a job description, the system identifies it as a job description.
When the content type is unclear, the system asks me to confirm what I uploaded.

Functional Title / Description: Extract structured information from the uploaded resume content.

User Story Statement: **As a** system, **I want to** identify and extract job titles from each position in the resume, **so that** I can categorize the user's work history.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Job Title Extraction

Acceptance Criteria: For each position listed, the system captures the job title.
If a job title cannot be determined, the system flags it for user clarification.

User Story Statement: **As a** system, **I want to** identify and extract company names from each position in the resume, **so that** I can track where the user has worked.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Company Name Extraction

Acceptance Criteria: For each position listed, the system captures the company name.
If a company name cannot be determined, the system flags it for user clarification.

User Story Statement: **As a** system, **I want to** identify and extract start and end dates for each position, **so that** I can calculate employment duration.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Employment Duration Calculation

Acceptance Criteria: For each position, the system captures the start date.
For each position, the system captures the end date (or "Present" if current).
The system calculates the duration of each position.

User Story Statement: **As a** system, **I want to** identify and extract individual bullet points from each position, **so that** I can analyze them individually.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Bullet Point Extraction

Acceptance Criteria: For each position, the system captures all bullet points.
Bullet points are associated with their parent position.

User Story Statement: **As a** system, **I want to** determine whether each position was remote, hybrid, or on-site, **so that** I can include this context in the analysis.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Work Environment Classification

Acceptance Criteria: If location type is mentioned, the system captures it.
If location type is not mentioned, the system marks it as unknown.

User Story Statement: **As a** system, **I want to** identify skills mentioned in the resume, **so that** I can categorize them for analysis.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Core Competency Identification

Acceptance Criteria: The system identifies technical skills (hard skills).
The system identifies interpersonal skills (soft skills).
Skills are associated with the positions where they were demonstrated.

Functional Title / Description: Evaluate the resume against quality criteria and provide scores.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see an overall score for my resume, **so that** I understand its general quality at a glance.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Quality Index Calculation

Acceptance Criteria: The system displays a single overall score (e.g., letter grade or percentage).
The score is based on multiple weighted factors.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** know how well my resume will perform with Applicant Tracking Systems, **so that** I can ensure it gets past automated screening.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: ATS Compatibility Scoring

Acceptance Criteria: The system provides an ATS compatibility score.
The score considers bullet point length.
The score considers header structure.
The score considers contact information formatting.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** know the quality of my resume content, **so that** I can improve my writing.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Narrative Impact Scoring

Acceptance Criteria: The system provides a content quality score.
The score considers action verb strength.
The score considers verb tense consistency.
The score considers action verb diversity.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** know how well my resume demonstrates measurable impact, **so that** I can add more metrics where needed.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Metric Density Evaluation

Acceptance Criteria: The system provides a quantifiable impact score.
The system identifies bullets that contain metrics (numbers, percentages, dollar amounts).
The system identifies bullets that lack metrics.

Business Rule: The target is for 70-80% of bullets to contain quantifiable metrics.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** know how well my resume covers relevant skills and industry keywords, **so that** I can ensure I'm presenting my qualifications effectively.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Keyword Strategy Assessment

Acceptance Criteria: The system provides a skills and keywords score.
The system identifies relevant industry terms present in the resume.

Functional Title / Description: Provide detailed analysis for each individual bullet point in the resume.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see whether each bullet point contains quantified metrics, **so that** I know which bullets need strengthening.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Metric Presence Detection

Acceptance Criteria: Each bullet displays an indicator showing if metrics are present.
The system recognizes percentages, currency values, and numeric quantities as metrics.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see the strength and category of each bullet's action verb, **so that** I can improve weak verbs and ensure diversity.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Verb Category Classification

Acceptance Criteria: Each bullet displays its action verb category.
The system flags weak or passive action verbs.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** know if my bullet points are the right length, **so that** they display properly in ATS systems.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Character Count Validation

Acceptance Criteria: Each bullet displays its character count.
The system flags bullets that are too short.
The system flags bullets that are too long.

Business Rule: Bullets should be between 100 and 210 characters.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see specific recommendations for improving each bullet, **so that** I know exactly what to fix.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Optimization Guidance Generation

Acceptance Criteria: If a bullet has issues, the system provides actionable suggestions.
Suggestions are prioritized by severity.

Functional Title / Description: Analyze the variety and strength of action verbs used across the resume.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see my action verbs organized by category, **so that** I can ensure I'm demonstrating a range of capabilities.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Categorize Action Verbs

Acceptance Criteria: The system groups action verbs into categories (e.g., Built, Led, Managed, Improved, Collaborated).
Each bullet's verb is assigned to a category.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see a visual representation of my verb category distribution, **so that** I can identify over-used or under-used categories.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Display Verb Distribution

Acceptance Criteria: The system displays the percentage of bullets in each verb category.
The system highlights categories that are under-represented.
The system highlights categories that are over-represented.

Business Rule: Each verb category should represent at least 5% of total bullets.
No verb category should exceed 40% of total bullets.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see my action verbs color-coded by category, **so that** I can visually assess diversity at a glance.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Color-Code Action Verbs

Acceptance Criteria: Each verb category has a distinct color.
The first word of each bullet is displayed in its category color.

Functional Title / Description: Analyze the resume from an external hiring manager's point of view.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see what job titles a hiring manager would infer from my resume, **so that** I can identify if my true role is being communicated.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Infer Job Titles from Work Performed
Functional Title / Description: Infer Job Titles from Work Performed

Acceptance Criteria: For each position, the system suggests what job title a reader would perceive.
The inferred title is based on achievements and responsibilities, not the stated title.
The system explains why it inferred each title.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see what seniority level my resume conveys, **so that** I can ensure I'm positioning myself appropriately.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Seniority Alignment Assessment

Acceptance Criteria: The system assesses apparent seniority based on scope and impact described.
Factors include team size, budget responsibility, and strategic scope.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see a synthesized summary of my career progression, **so that** I understand how my trajectory appears to others.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Career Progression Summary

Acceptance Criteria: The system provides a narrative summary of the user's career arc.
The narrative is based on the inferred titles and progression.

Functional Title / Description: Organize identified issues by severity to help users prioritize fixes.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see my resume issues organized by severity, **so that** I can fix the most critical problems first.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Issue Severity Classification

Acceptance Criteria: Issues are categorized as Blocker, Risk, or Tweak.
Blockers are issues that may cause automatic rejection.
Risks are issues that significantly lower resume impact.
Tweaks are minor improvements for polish.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see a quick count of issues by severity, **so that** I understand the overall scope of improvements needed.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Repair Scope Aggregation

Acceptance Criteria: The system displays the count of Blockers.
The system displays the count of Risks.
The system displays the count of Tweaks.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see a consolidated list of all repairs needed, **so that** I have a clear action plan.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Actionable Fix Prioritization

Acceptance Criteria: The list is ordered by severity (Blockers first, then Risks, then Tweaks).
Each item references the specific location (position and bullet).
Each item includes a suggested fix.

Functional Title / Description: Create a structured, reusable document containing the user's complete work history.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want** the system to create a structured record of my work history from my resume, **so that** I can reuse it for future job applications.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Master Profile Consolidation

Acceptance Criteria: The job history contains all positions extracted from the resume.
Each position includes dates, company, title, responsibilities, and achievements.
The job history includes a master skills inventory.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want** my job history to include an automatically generated professional summary, **so that** I have a starting point for my resume header.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Summary Synthesis Generation

Acceptance Criteria: The job history includes a 2-3 paragraph professional summary.
The summary synthesizes the user's career highlights and expertise.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** download my job history to my computer, **so that** I can save it for future use.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Profile Export Functionality

Acceptance Criteria: The system provides a download option.
The downloaded file is in a format I can open and read.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** choose the format for my job history download, **so that** I can use the format that works best for my needs.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Cross-Platform Compatibility Export

Acceptance Criteria: The system offers at least two export format options.
One format is optimized for human readability.
One format is optimized for importing into other tools.

Business Rule: (12-Section Schema) Every job history file MUST follow a strictly defined structure with 12 sections (Personal Info, Master Summary, Education, Certifications, Hard Skills, Soft Skills, Job History, Projects, Awards, Publications/Speaking, Volunteer, Additional Info).
(Standardized Tags) All AI models MUST use identical XML tag names without synonyms for all sections and metadata fields.
(No Skipped Sections) Mandatory sections that have no data MUST be marked as "Not applicable" rather than being omitted.
(Master Skills Inventory) All skills identified in individual roles MUST be aggregated into a comprehensive "Master Skills Inventory".
(Promotion Handling) Multiple roles or promotions at the same company MUST be shown as separate entries with their own dates and responsibilities to demonstrate career progression.
(Metric Traceability) Every metric (e.g., $, %, multipliers) MUST be uniquely tied to the specific position where it was achieved.

Functional Title / Description: Allow users to compare their experience against a specific job description to understand how well they match the requirements.
Allow users to provide a job description for comparison.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** paste a job description into the system, **so that** I can compare it against my experience.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: JD Content Ingestion

Acceptance Criteria: The system provides a text input area for the job description.
The system accepts job descriptions of typical length.

User Story Statement: **As a** system, **I want to** verify that the pasted content is a job description, **so that** I don't analyze irrelevant content.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: JD Integrity Validation

Acceptance Criteria: The system detects if the content appears to be a job description.
The system warns the user if the content does not appear to be a job description.
The system can distinguish job descriptions from LinkedIn articles or other content.

Functional Title / Description: Extract and categorize requirements from the job description.

User Story Statement: **As a** system, **I want to** identify skills marked as required in the job description, **so that** I can assess the user's match.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Mandatory Skill Identification

Acceptance Criteria: The system identifies skills labeled as "required" or "must have."
Required skills are listed separately from preferred skills.

User Story Statement: **As a** system, **I want to** identify skills marked as preferred in the job description, **so that** I can assess the user's additional qualifications.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Desirable Attribute Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: The system identifies skills labeled as "preferred" or "nice to have."
Preferred skills are listed separately from required skills.

User Story Statement: **As a** system, **I want to** identify years of experience required, **so that** I can compare against the user's background.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Experience Benchmark Extraction

Acceptance Criteria: The system identifies stated experience requirements (e.g., "5+ years").
The system identifies the type of experience required (e.g., "in product management").

User Story Statement: **As a** system, **I want to** identify education requirements, **so that** I can compare against the user's qualifications.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Academic Prerequisite Identification

Acceptance Criteria: The system identifies required degrees or certifications.
The system distinguishes required from preferred education.

User Story Statement: **As a** system, **I want to** identify work location requirements, **so that** I can flag compatibility issues.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Geographic Eligibility Checking

Acceptance Criteria: The system identifies if the role is remote, hybrid, or on-site.
The system identifies geographic restrictions (e.g., "must be in California").

Functional Title / Description: Calculate how well the user matches the job requirements.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see an overall fit score for a job, **so that** I can quickly assess if I should apply.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Strategic Alignment Scoring

Acceptance Criteria: The system displays a percentage fit score.
The score reflects how many requirements the user meets.

User Story Statement: **As a** system, **I want to** weight required skills more heavily than preferred skills, **so that** the fit score accurately reflects job priorities.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Multi-Tier Skill Weighting

Acceptance Criteria: Required skills contribute more to the score than preferred skills.
The weighting is transparent to the user.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** understand what my fit score means, **so that** I can make an informed decision about applying.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Match Level Categorization

Acceptance Criteria: Scores above 90% are labeled as "Excellent Match."
Scores between 80-89% are labeled as "Good Match with Minor Gaps."
Scores between 75-79% are labeled as "Weak Match."
Scores below 75% are labeled as "Poor Match."

Functional Title / Description: Show the user which specific requirements they meet or miss.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see which job requirements I meet, **so that** I understand my strengths for this role.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Critical Constraint Verification

Acceptance Criteria: Matched requirements are clearly listed.
For each match, the system shows which part of my experience demonstrates it.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see which job requirements I partially meet, **so that** I understand where I have some relevant experience.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Desirable Fit Enhancement

Acceptance Criteria: Partially matched requirements are clearly listed.
The system explains why the match is partial.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see which job requirements I do not meet, **so that** I understand my gaps.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Qualification Gap Analysis

Acceptance Criteria: Missing requirements are clearly listed.
The system explains why no match was found.

Functional Title / Description: Identify fundamental mismatches that make a job unsuitable.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** be warned if a job's location requirements conflict with my situation, **so that** I don't waste time on incompatible roles.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Flag Location Incompatibility

Acceptance Criteria: If the job requires on-site and I'm remote-only, the system warns me.
If the job has geographic restrictions I don't meet, the system warns me.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** be warned if I'm missing critical required skills, **so that** I can make an informed decision about applying.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Flag Critical Skill Gaps

Acceptance Criteria: The system identifies skills that appear multiple times or are emphasized in the job description.
If I'm missing these critical skills, the system displays a warning.

Functional Title / Description: Allow users to generate tailored resume content optimized for a specific job description.
Improve existing resume bullets or generate new ones.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** receive improved versions of my current resume bullets, **so that** I can strengthen my existing content.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Bullet Tailoring Algorithm

Acceptance Criteria: For each bullet I provide, the system suggests improved versions.
Improvements maintain the factual accuracy of my original statement.
Improvements address identified issues (weak verbs, missing metrics, length).

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** receive new resume bullets tailored to a specific job description, **so that** my resume is optimized for that application.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Keyword Infusion Strategy

Acceptance Criteria: Generated bullets incorporate relevant keywords from the job description.
Generated bullets are based only on experience from my job history.
Generated bullets meet length and formatting requirements.

Business Rule: The system will not claim experience I don't have.
All bullets must be based on evidenced experience.

User Story Statement: **As a** system, **I want to** ensure generated bullets use a variety of action verb categories, **so that** the resume demonstrates a range of capabilities.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Linguistic Variety Enforcement

Acceptance Criteria: Generated bullets collectively use all five action verb categories.
No single category is over-represented.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** generate a comprehensive professional summary, **so that** I have a reusable summary for my resume.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Master Brand Synthesis

Acceptance Criteria: The summary is 2-3 paragraphs.
The summary synthesizes my career highlights.
The summary includes key skills and achievements.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** generate a summary tailored to a specific job description, **so that** my resume header is optimized for that application.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Targeted Value Proposition

Acceptance Criteria: The summary is 3-4 sentences.
The summary incorporates keywords from the job description.
The summary highlights qualifications relevant to the job.

Functional Title / Description: Ensure all generated content meets quality standards.

User Story Statement: **As a** system, **I want to** verify that all generated bullets meet quality requirements, **so that** users receive polished, ready-to-use content.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Automated Quality Gatekeeping

Acceptance Criteria: All bullets meet length requirements.
All bullets start with past-tense action verbs.
All bullets are grammatically correct.

User Story Statement: **As a** system, **I want to** automatically fix common quality issues, **so that** users don't receive flawed content.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Autonomous Content Correction

Acceptance Criteria: The system detects and corrects bullets starting with "-ing" words.
The system removes repeated phrases across bullets.

Functional Title / Description: Deliver finalized resume content in usable formats.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** receive my optimized bullets in plain text format, **so that** I can easily copy and paste them into my resume.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Plain Text Content Export

Acceptance Criteria: The export contains no special formatting.
I can copy the text directly into any document.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** be reminded to proofread the generated content, **so that** I catch any errors before submitting my resume.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Grammar & Tone Verification Guidance

Acceptance Criteria: The system displays a recommendation to perform a secondary grammar check.
The recommendation appears with the final output.

Functional Title / Description: Help users discover and articulate hidden achievements and metrics through guided questioning.
Ask targeted questions to uncover additional achievements and metrics.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** be asked about the size of teams I managed or worked with, **so that** I can add this context to my experience.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Structural Scope Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: For relevant positions, the system asks about team size.
My answers are recorded for use in my job history.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** be asked about budgets I managed, **so that** I can demonstrate financial responsibility.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Fiscal Impact Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: For relevant positions, the system asks about budget responsibility.
My answers are recorded for use in my job history.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** be asked about the quantifiable impact of my work, **so that** I can add metrics to my achievements.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Quantifiable Success Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: The system asks about time savings, cost reductions, and efficiency gains.
The system asks about user impact (how many people were affected).

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** be asked about significant challenges I faced, **so that** I can articulate my problem-solving abilities.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: S.T.A.R. Context Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: The system asks about obstacles and how I overcame them.
My answers are recorded for use in my job history.

Functional Title / Description: Update the user's job history with newly discovered information.

User Story Statement: **As a** system, **I want to** add newly discovered information to the user's job history, **so that** future analyses benefit from the enriched data.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Data Profile Enrichment

Acceptance Criteria: New information is added to the appropriate position.
Existing information is not overwritten unless the user confirms.

User Story Statement: **As a** system, **I want to** update the version number when changes are made, **so that** there is a clear record of modifications.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Chronological Audit Trail

Acceptance Criteria: The version number is incremented when changes are saved.

Functional Title / Description: Allow users to add, edit, or remove positions without full re-analysis.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** add a new position to my job history, **so that** I can include recent experience without re-analyzing my entire resume.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Chronological Profile Extension

Acceptance Criteria: I can add a new position with all relevant information.
The new position is placed in chronological order.
Running totals (years of experience, skills) are updated.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** edit information in an existing position, **so that** I can correct errors or add details.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Position Record Refinement

Acceptance Criteria: I can modify any field in an existing position.
My changes are saved and reflected in the job history.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** remove a position from my job history, **so that** I can exclude irrelevant experience.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Profile Curation Management

Acceptance Criteria: I can select a position to remove.
The system asks me to confirm before removing.
Running totals are updated after removal.

Business Rule: (BAR/CAR Achievement Format) Achievements MUST be documented using a structured Context-Action-Result (CAR) or Background-Action-Result (BAR) format.
(Individual Contribution Validation) The system MUST distinguish between team-wide accomplishments and the user's specific individual contribution.

(Surgical Update Philosophy) When building the narrative, the system MUST perform "surgical updates"—adding or enhancing specific details without removing, rewriting, or losing existing valid content.

(Honest Limitations Disclosure) Any noted constraints or limited exposures (e.g., "basic familiarity only") MUST be captured in an "Honest Limitations" section to prevent over-claiming in the optimized resume.
(Evidence Linkage) Every skill or achievement identified during the narrative build MUST be linked to specific evidence (using company, title, and dates).
(Hard/Soft Skill Classification) Skills MUST be classified as HARD (measurable technical knowledge) or SOFT (interpersonal/behavioral) using the standardized project decision tree.

Functional Title / Description: Provide a visual interface for interacting with the system.
Allow users to choose which AI model to use for analysis.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** choose which AI model to use, **so that** I can balance speed, quality, and cost.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Compute Tier Selection

Acceptance Criteria: The system displays available model options.
Each option includes a description of its characteristics.
I can select a model before analysis begins.

User Story Statement: **As a** system, **I want to** require the user to select a model before starting analysis, **so that** they make an informed choice.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Model Policy Enforcement

Acceptance Criteria: The "Analyze" button is disabled until a model is selected.
A message prompts the user to select a model.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see which models require a paid subscription, **so that** I don't select an option I can't use.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Subscription Transparency Display

Acceptance Criteria: Models requiring a paid subscription are clearly marked.
If I select a paid model but don't have a subscription, I receive an error message.

Functional Title / Description: Help users understand and manage their usage limits.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see how many tokens each model uses, **so that** I can plan my usage within my limits.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Resource Consumption Estimation

Acceptance Criteria: The system displays estimated token usage per model.
The information is displayed before I start analysis.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** understand my daily usage limits, **so that** I can use the system strategically.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Allocation Awareness Display

Acceptance Criteria: The system explains the usage limit (e.g., tokens per time period).
The system explains that limits are shared across all features.

Functional Title / Description: Display helpful error messages when problems occur.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** understand when I've hit my usage limit, **so that** I know when I can try again.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Concurrency Limit Management

Acceptance Criteria: The system displays a clear message when the limit is reached.
The message includes when the limit will reset.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** understand when analysis fails, **so that** I know how to resolve the issue.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Graceful Degradation Handling

Acceptance Criteria: The system displays a clear error message.
The message suggests possible solutions (e.g., try again, shorten resume).

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** retry a failed analysis, **so that** I can attempt to complete the process.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: System Recovery Retry

Acceptance Criteria: The system allows me to retry after a failure.
After multiple failures, the system provides more detailed guidance.

Functional Title / Description: Present analysis results in a visually appealing, easy-to-understand format.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see a visual summary of my analysis results, **so that** I can understand my overall status quickly.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Executive Insight Visualization

Acceptance Criteria: The summary includes my overall score.
The summary includes counts of issues by severity.
The summary is displayed prominently at the top of the results.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** expand and collapse position details, **so that** I can focus on one position at a time.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Information Hierarchy Management

Acceptance Criteria: Each position has a header I can click to expand or collapse.
When collapsed, only the position summary is visible.
When expanded, all bullet details are visible.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see a chart showing my action verb distribution, **so that** I can quickly assess diversity.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Linguistic Balance Visualization

Acceptance Criteria: The chart shows a bar for each verb category.
The bars are proportional to the percentage of bullets in each category.
The chart uses the same colors as the verb color coding.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** expand or collapse all position sections at once, **so that** I can quickly navigate the report.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: UI State Mass-Toggle

Acceptance Criteria: The system provides an "Expand All" button.
The system provides a "Collapse All" button.
Clicking "Expand All" opens all position sections.
Clicking "Collapse All" closes all position sections.

Functional Title / Description: Ensure job history output is consistent regardless of which AI model is used.

User Story Statement: **As a** system, **I want to** use standardized templates for job history generation, **so that** any AI model produces identical structure.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Schema Consistency Enforcement

Acceptance Criteria: All AI models reference the same job history template.
Output structure is identical regardless of which model is used.

User Story Statement: **As a** system, **I want to** generate job history in both XML and Markdown formats, **so that** the output is optimized for both machine and human consumption.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Multi-Format Schema Delivery

Acceptance Criteria: The system generates an XML-structured file for machine readability.
The system generates a Markdown file for human presentation.
The XML file is the source of truth.

User Story Statement: **As a** system, **I want to** validate job history files against the schema, **so that** I can catch structural errors.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Structural Integrity Verification

Acceptance Criteria: The system can validate job history files.
Validation catches missing sections.
Validation catches malformed tags.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** convert my job history from XML to Markdown, **so that** I can view it in a human-readable format.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Schema-Aware Format Transformation

Acceptance Criteria: The system can convert from XML to Markdown.
The converted file maintains all content.

Functional Title / Description: Allow users to run the Resume Analyzer locally using Ollama, without requiring a Claude API subscription.
Connect to a local Ollama instance for AI processing.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see whether Ollama is running on my computer, **so that** I know if I can use the analyzer.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Backend Health Monitoring

Acceptance Criteria: The system displays Ollama connection status (Connected, Disconnected, Checking).
When connected, the system shows how many models are available.
When disconnected, the system provides instructions to start Ollama.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** manually refresh the Ollama connection status, **so that** I can retry after starting Ollama.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Connection State Synchronization

Acceptance Criteria: The system provides a "Check Status" button.
Clicking the button rechecks the Ollama connection.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see a clear warning if Ollama is not running, **so that** I know how to fix the issue.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Service Status Awareness

Acceptance Criteria: If Ollama is not running, display a warning banner.
The warning includes the command to start Ollama.

Functional Title / Description: Allow users to select from locally installed Ollama models.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see which Ollama models I have installed, **so that** I can choose one for analysis.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Local Resource Inventory

Acceptance Criteria: The system shows only models that are installed locally.
Each model shows a name and description.
One model is marked as recommended.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want** the system to automatically select the recommended model if available, **so that** I can start analyzing quickly.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Cognitive Model Defaulting

Acceptance Criteria: If the recommended model is installed, it is pre-selected.
Users can still change to a different model.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see how to install additional models, **so that** I can expand my options.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Setup Guidance Delivery

Acceptance Criteria: If configured models are not installed, the system shows installation instructions.
Instructions include the correct `ollama pull` commands.

Functional Title / Description: Support multiple open-source models via Ollama.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** use the Llama 3.1 model, **so that** I can get balanced speed and quality (recommended).
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Llama Architecture Compatibility

Acceptance Criteria: Llama 3.1 is available as a model option.
Llama 3.1 is marked as the recommended model.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** use the Mistral model, **so that** I can get fast analysis for shorter resumes.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Mistral Architecture Compatibility

Acceptance Criteria: Mistral is available as a model option.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** use the Gemma 2 model, **so that** I can get detailed technical analysis.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Gemma Architecture Compatibility

Acceptance Criteria: Gemma 2 is available as a model option.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** use the Qwen 2.5 model, **so that** I can get creative bullet rewrites.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Qwen Architecture Compatibility

Acceptance Criteria: Qwen 2.5 is available as a model option.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** use the Phi-3 model, **so that** I can get precise technical details.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Phi Architecture Compatibility

Acceptance Criteria: Phi-3 is available as a model option.

Functional Title / Description: Allow users to upload resume files from their computer.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** upload a text file from my computer, **so that** I don't have to copy and paste.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Local Multi-Format Ingestion

Acceptance Criteria: The system provides a file upload area.
I can click to browse for a file.
The system accepts .txt files.
The file contents are loaded into the input area.

Functional Title / Description: Provide helpful error messages for local mode issues.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** understand when there's a connection problem with Ollama, **so that** I can fix it.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Connectivity Fault Notification

Acceptance Criteria: The system explains that Ollama cannot be reached.
The error provides troubleshooting steps.
The error includes the command to start Ollama.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** understand when the model produces invalid output, **so that** I can try again or switch models.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Parsing Fault Recovery

Acceptance Criteria: The system explains that the response has a syntax error.
The error suggests switching models.
The error suggests simplifying the resume.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see debug information when troubleshooting, **so that** I can diagnose issues.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Operational Transparency Toggle

Acceptance Criteria: The system provides a toggle to show/hide debug info.
Debug info includes Ollama status and selected model.
Debug info references browser console for detailed logs.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** be reminded that my data is not saved, **so that** I remember to download my results.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Data Persistence Awareness

Acceptance Criteria: The system displays a warning that data is not saved.
The warning encourages downloading results before closing.

Functional Title / Description: Provide visual interfaces for the Job Fit Analyzer, Resume Customizer, and Narrative Builder features, following the design patterns established by the Resume Analyzer GUI.
Visual interface for comparing user experience against job descriptions.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** paste or upload a job description in the GUI as a standalone action, **so that** I can compare it against my experience at any time.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Standalone JD Intake Interface

Acceptance Criteria: The system provides a text area to paste a job description.
The system provides a file upload option for job descriptions.
The interface matches the Resume Analyzer's input design.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** select which job history to use for comparison, **so that** I can use the most current version.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Source Profile Selection

Acceptance Criteria: The system shows available job history files.
I can select which file to use for comparison.
The system indicates which file was last used.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see my fit score displayed visually, **so that** I can quickly understand my match level.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Strategic Fit Visualization

Acceptance Criteria: The fit score is displayed as a large, prominent number.
The score is color-coded by match level (green for excellent, yellow for good, red for poor).
The match level label is displayed (Excellent Match, Good Match, etc.).

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see a visual list of matched requirements, **so that** I know my strengths.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Matched Constraint List

Acceptance Criteria: Matched requirements are displayed with a green checkmark.
Each match shows the source evidence from my job history.
The list is expandable/collapsible.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see a visual list of missing requirements, **so that** I know my gaps.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Identified Gap Enumeration

Acceptance Criteria: Missing requirements are displayed with a red X.
Required skills are distinguished from preferred skills.
The list is expandable/collapsible.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see blocking conditions displayed prominently, **so that** I don't waste time on incompatible roles.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Critical Blocker Notification

Acceptance Criteria: Blocking conditions are displayed at the top of the results.
Blockers use red/warning styling to draw attention.
Each blocker explains why it's a dealbreaker.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** download my fit analysis, **so that** I can save it for reference.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Analysis Asset Export

Acceptance Criteria: The system provides a download button.
The export includes the fit score, matches, and gaps.
I can choose between formats (Markdown, plain text).

Functional Title / Description: Visual interface for generating and optimizing resume content.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** select which bullets to optimize from a visual list, **so that** I can focus on specific content.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Optimization Scope Selection

Acceptance Criteria: My current bullets are displayed in a list.
I can select/deselect bullets using checkboxes.
I can select all or none with a single click.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** specify the target job or industry, **so that** the optimization is tailored.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Optimization Context Injection

Acceptance Criteria: The system provides an input for target job title.
The system provides an optional input for job description.
The system provides an optional input for industry.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see my original bullets next to the optimized versions, **so that** I can compare them.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Comparative Result Visualization

Acceptance Criteria: Original bullet is displayed on the left.
Optimized bullet is displayed on the right.
Differences are highlighted (added keywords, stronger verbs).

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** accept or reject each optimization individually, **so that** I maintain control.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Individual Correction Acceptance

Acceptance Criteria: Each optimization has Accept and Reject buttons.
Accepted optimizations are marked with a checkmark.
Rejected optimizations can be re-optimized or kept original.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** request alternative versions of an optimization, **so that** I can choose the best fit.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Regenerative Variation Request

Acceptance Criteria: Each optimization has a "Try Again" button.
Clicking generates up to 3 alternative versions.
I can select from the alternatives.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** copy my optimized bullets to the clipboard, **so that** I can paste them into my resume.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Immediate Content Transfer

Acceptance Criteria: The system provides a "Copy All" button.
Each bullet has an individual copy button.
The system confirms when content is copied.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** request a professional summary through the GUI, **so that** I can generate resume header content.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Professional Brand Synthesis Interface

Acceptance Criteria: The system provides a "Generate Summary" button.
I can choose between master summary and job-specific summary.
The generated summary is displayed in an editable text area.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** download all my optimized content, **so that** I can use it in my resume.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Tailored Asset Acquisition

Acceptance Criteria: The system provides a download button for accepted optimizations.
The export is in plain text format for easy pasting.
The export is organized by position.

Functional Title / Description: Visual interface for discovering hidden achievements through probing questions.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** start building my narrative directly via probing questions, **so that** I can capture my achievements even before performing a full resume analysis.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Interview-Style Achievement Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: Questions are displayed one at a time in a conversational format.
Previous questions and answers are visible above.
The interface resembles a chat or interview.
The system can suggest trigger-ing a Resume Analysis if it detects missing foundational context during the narrative build.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** type my answers to probing questions, **so that** I can provide detailed responses.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Conversational Response Capture

Acceptance Criteria: Each question has a text area for my answer.
I can submit my answer with Enter or a button.
Answers auto-save as drafts.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** skip questions I can't answer now, **so that** I can complete them later.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Non-Linear Session Navigation

Acceptance Criteria: Each question has a "Skip" button.
Skipped questions are saved for later.
I can see a count of skipped questions.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see metrics the system extracted from my answers, **so that** I can verify accuracy.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Extract Evidence Verification

Acceptance Criteria: Extracted metrics are highlighted in my answers.
I can confirm or correct extracted values.
Confirmed metrics are marked with a checkmark.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** preview how my job history will look with new information, **so that** I can review before saving.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Preview Enriched Job History

Acceptance Criteria: The system shows a preview of the enriched position.
New information is highlighted.
I can approve or edit before saving.

Business Rule: (Template Alignment) The preview MUST reflect the 12-section structure defined in the Job History Template (Metadata, Summary, Responsibilities, Achievements, Hard Skills, Soft Skills, Tools, Metrics, Industry, Methodology, Decisions, Team Scope).
(BAR/CAR Transformation) Information extracted from interview answers MUST be transformed into the structured CAR (Context-Action-Result) format within the `<achievement>` tags.
(Section-Specific Updating) The system MUST highlight which specific sections of the XML template (e.g., Section 7: Job History vs Section 5: Hard Skills) are being enriched by the current session.
(Metric Attribution) All metrics previewed in `<impact_metrics>` MUST be cross-referenced against the `<key_achievements>` section to ensure internal consistency within the position block.
(Schema Validation) The preview MUST be rendered from a valid XML stream that adheres to the `job_history_template.xml` schema before being displayed to the user.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** save my enriched job history, **so that** future analyses use the new information.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Profile Evolution Preservation

Acceptance Criteria: The system provides a "Save" button.
Saving increments the job history version.
The system confirms successful save.

Functional Title / Description: Allow users to navigate between all features in a unified interface.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see a navigation menu for all features, **so that** I can switch between them.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Centralized Module Navigation

Acceptance Criteria: A navigation bar or sidebar shows all available features.
Features include: Resume Analyzer, Job Fit Analyzer, Resume Customizer, Narrative Builder.
The current feature is highlighted.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want** my session data to persist when I switch features, **so that** I don't lose my work.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Cross-Module State Retention

Acceptance Criteria: Switching features preserves my current analysis.
I can return to a feature and continue where I left off.
The system warns if I'm about to lose unsaved work.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see suggested next steps based on my current state, **so that** I can follow the most logical path (Enrich -> Customize).
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Display Workflow Guidance

Acceptance Criteria: After Resume Analyzer, suggest Narrative Builder (to enrich data) or Job Fit Analyzer (to check a specific JD).
After Narrative Builder, suggest Resume Customizer (to apply the new narrative to the resume).
Suggestions explain the benefit of each next step.
Job Fit Analyzer is presented as a utility that can be accessed at any time regardless of the core optimization path.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want to** see my progress through the overall workflow, **so that** I know how much I've completed.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Workflow Completion Monitoring

Acceptance Criteria: The system shows which features I've completed.
Each feature shows a completion status (Not Started, In Progress, Complete).
Progress is saved across sessions if I download/upload my data.

Functional Title / Description: Ensure all feature GUIs use consistent visual design.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want** all features to use the same color scheme, **so that** the application feels cohesive.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Universal Color Scheme Uniformity

Acceptance Criteria: All features use the dark slate theme.
Primary actions use blue.
Warnings use orange, errors use red, success uses green.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want** buttons, inputs, and cards to look the same across features, **so that** I can predict interactions.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Interaction Pattern Predictability

Acceptance Criteria: All buttons have consistent styling.
All text areas have consistent styling.
All cards and containers have consistent styling.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want** error messages to look and behave consistently, **so that** I can recognize and resolve issues.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Standardized Feedback Delivery

Acceptance Criteria: All error messages use the same red notification style.
All error messages include actionable guidance.
Error icons are consistent across features.

User Story Statement: **As a** user, **I want** loading states to look the same across features, **so that** I know when the system is working.
User Story Title Column: User Story Title: Synchronous State Visualization

Acceptance Criteria: All features use the same spinner component.
Loading text describes what's happening.
Buttons are disabled during loading.
